content.1: Canst thou draw out leviathan with an hook? or his tongue with a cord
content.2: Canst thou put an hook into his nose? or bore his jaw through with a thorn?
content.3: Will he make many supplications unto thee? will he speak soft
content.4: Will he make a covenant with thee? wilt thou take him for a servant for ever?
content.5: Wilt thou play with him as
content.6: Shall the companions make a banquet of him? shall they part him among the merchants?
content.7: Canst thou fill his skin with barbed irons? or his head with fish spears?
content.8: Lay thine hand upon him, remember the battle, do no more.
content.9: Behold, the hope of him is in vain: shall not
content.11: Who hath prevented me, that I should repay
content.12: I will not conceal his parts, nor his power, nor his comely proportion.
content.13: Who can discover the face of his garment?
content.14: Who can open the doors of his face? his teeth
content.16: One is so near to another, that no air can come between them.
content.17: They are joined one to another, they stick together, that they cannot be sundered.
content.18: By his neesings a light doth shine, and his eyes
content.19: Out of his mouth go burning lamps,
content.20: Out of his nostrils goeth smoke, as
content.21: His breath kindleth coals, and a flame goeth out of his mouth.
content.22: In his neck remaineth strength, and sorrow is turned into joy before him.
content.23: The flakes of his flesh are joined together: they are firm in themselves; they cannot be moved.
content.24: His heart is as firm as a stone; yea, as hard as a piece of the nether
content.25: When he raiseth up himself, the mighty are afraid: by reason of breakings they purify themselves.
content.26: The sword of him that layeth at him cannot hold: the spear, the dart, nor the habergeon.
content.28: The arrow cannot make him flee: slingstones are turned with him into stubble.
content.29: Darts are counted as stubble: he laugheth at the shaking of a spear.
content.31: He maketh the deep to boil like a pot: he maketh the sea like a pot of ointment.
content.32: He maketh a path to shine after him;
content.33: Upon earth there is not his like, who is made without fear.
